thread.title: InventHelp Invention Facilitates Firewood Cutting (JMC-1729)

author: cbs8
title: InventHelp Invention Facilitates Firewood Cutting (JMC-1729)
text:
Pittsburgh-based InventHelp is attempting to submit the CHAINSAW CUT GUIDE to companies for their consideration.
PITTSBURGH, PA (PRWEB) October 21, 2015
It can be difficult to cut firewood into same-size sections, so an inventor from Edinburg, Texas, decided that there needs to be a simple but effective way to do this.
He then created a prototype of the CHAINSAW CUT GUIDE, which provides a quick, easy and neat way to cut firewood. It ensures that sections are all the same size, which eliminates the need for guesswork. Overall, it promotes efficiency. The invention is easy to use and suitable for both professional and DIY woodcutters.
The original design was submitted to the Telemarketing office of InventHelp. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 14-JMC-1729, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp
